messages.subject: RE: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Re: Question for high School unschooling
messages.msgSnippet: I know an unschooling friendly evaluator in Maine who can do NH portfolios too.  Not sure how far away from Maine you are but if you don t find someone close
messages.messageBody:
I know an unschooling friendly evaluator in Maine who can do NH portfolios
too. Not sure how far away from Maine you are but if you don't find someone
close to you, let me know and I'll give you her name and number off list.



Angela

game-enthusiast@....



[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Re: Question for high School unschooling
messages.msgSnippet: ... You have the option of a portfolio and evaluation - if you contact your state organization   they can help you find an
messages.messageBody:
On Apr 24, 2005, at 7:42 AM, REBECCA wrote:

> Sorry that would have helped. We are in NH.

You have the option of a portfolio and evaluation - if you contact your
state organization <www.nhhomeschooling> they can help you find an
unschooling-friendly evaluator, I bet.

-pam

Sorry that would have helped. We are in NH.


--- In UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com, "soggyboysmom"
<debra.rossing@m...> wrote:
>
> --- In UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com, "REBECCA"
> <shdhavknown@y...> wrote:
> >
> >
> > We have pretty much unschooled for the year. My son is in ninth
> grade
> > this year my daughter in fourth. For the state we either need to
> send
> > in testing results or an evaluation of their portfolio. What does
> > everyone do to satisfy the states need for proof that the
children
> are
> > learning? Last year we tested which was fine and they both did
great
> > but this year with my son being in High Shcool I don't know if
that
> is
> > still an option. Any advice would be greatly appreciated.
> >
> > Rebecca
> What state you are in would be helpful for providing info. Where we
> are (CT) there is no requirement to do testing or portfolio or any
> evaluation at all at any time, no recordkeeping, nada. So it would
> help if we knew where you are so that folks from that area could
point
> you in the proper direction.
> --Deb

messages.subject: Re: Question for high School unschooling
messages.msgSnippet: ... grade ... send ... are ... is ... What state you are in would be helpful for providing info. Where we are (CT) there is no requirement to do testing or
messages.messageBody:
--- In UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com, "REBECCA"
<shdhavknown@y...> wrote:
>
>
> We have pretty much unschooled for the year. My son is in ninth
grade
> this year my daughter in fourth. For the state we either need to
send
> in testing results or an evaluation of their portfolio. What does
> everyone do to satisfy the states need for proof that the children
are
> learning? Last year we tested which was fine and they both did great
> but this year with my son being in High Shcool I don't know if that
is
> still an option. Any advice would be greatly appreciated.
>
> Rebecca
What state you are in would be helpful for providing info. Where we
are (CT) there is no requirement to do testing or portfolio or any
evaluation at all at any time, no recordkeeping, nada. So it would
help if we knew where you are so that folks from that area could point
you in the proper direction.
--Deb

messages.subject: Question for high School unschooling
messages.msgSnippet: We have pretty much unschooled for the year. My son is in ninth grade this year my daughter in fourth. For the state we either need to send in testing results
messages.messageBody:
We have pretty much unschooled for the year. My son is in ninth grade
this year my daughter in fourth. For the state we either need to send
in testing results or an evaluation of their portfolio. What does
everyone do to satisfy the states need for proof that the children are
learning? Last year we tested which was fine and they both did great
but this year with my son being in High Shcool I don't know if that is
still an option. Any advice would be greatly appreciated.

Rebecca
